subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: Previously on
Survivor: (roaring)
(twittering) (chattering)
18 Americans embarked on a journey to one of the most
remote regions of Africa. Welcome to Survivor: Gabon,
Earth's last Eden. The diverse group included
a high school physics teacher, a world championship video game
player, and an Olympic athlete. >> I am a 2004 gold medalist in
the women's 4 x 400-meter relay. >> PROBST: As they split into
two tribes, Ace and Sugar connected right off the bat.
>> I don't think it would be appropriate for a photographer
not to have a model. Sugar, please.
>> Oh! >> PROBST: The tribes were
called Fang, in red, and, Kota, wearing yellow.
Go! They immediately raced for
individual immunity and extra food.
Marcus has the idol for Kota. For Fang, GC grabs the idol.
Fang lost the challenge by a landslide.
Kota wins corn and beans! From the very beginning, Kota
was a tribe that could do no wrong.
>> Our morale was super-high. We're all excited.
We love our team. >> PROBST: The yellow tribe
was in perfect harmony. >> I felt a little yoga would
really get our energy flowing, the chakras would be all in
time. >> PROBST: Almost.
>> Ace is kind of getting on my nerves.
>> PROBST: Kota's smallest tribe mate, Paloma, was making waves.
>> Ace is getting on my nerves. He does not shut up.
>> PROBST: But Kota's problems seem insignificant compared
to Fang's. After only six days, the red
tribe was starting to look like one of the worst tribes in
Survivor history. >> This tribe is hopeless.
They're idiots. >> PROBST: They lost an immunity
challenge badly, and voted out one of their best athletes.
They selected a tribe leader, GC, and he quit the next day.
>> I didn't want to be a leader. I'm not going to let y'all force
me to be the leader. >> PROBST: Gillian's not
helping. Fang is falling behind.
They lost yet another immunity challenge, and then finally,
they did something that was completely out of character.
They made a unified decision. They unanimously voted out their
oldest and weakest player. Gillian, the tribe has spoken.
>> Bummer. >> PROBST: 16 are left.
Who will be voted out tonight? >> Thank God for another night.
>> Hell, yeah, man. Whatever happens, we made it
another night, you guys. >> Tribal Council was
a no-brainer. Gillian, you got to go.
We got rid of a major physical weak link.
>> Tomorrow is going to be a new day.
>> We got to win tomorrow. We have to.
(clamoring) >> And I don't care if it's
physical or whatever-- bring it on.
Ahh! Okay. (laughter)
>> I would like to start winning, but the tribe that I
have, I still don't believe it's possible.
>> Are you trying to break that? >> The problem is that they're
stupid. I really shouldn't blame them
for being complete idiots, but they are.
They don't know it, but, but they are.
(theme song playing)  Captioning sponsored by
CBS PARAMOUNT  NETWORK TELEVISION
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa >> Oh, man, we're getting it
cracking out here. >> It's day seven, and we're
over halfway finished with our rice.
Someone had the bright idea of three meals a day.
You know, this is Survivor. Three meals a day?
It's ridiculous. We're running low on rice.
We're running out. It's not "maybe." It's a fact.
I mean, I love three meals a day, but can we compromise
at two? Two meals a day?
>> I can. >> I can.
>> I'm fine with two. >> I just, I don't know.
I just think, uh, everybody was eating so much at first.
I remember throwing away a half a pot of rice the first
day. That wasted so much of our rice.
And now I'm suffering because some people chose to do that
early on. >> I'm not suffering.
>> I am. >> In my opinion, the cancer in
the tribe is GC. He cannot be told anything.
And our tribe is going to continue to have problems until
that cancer is excised. >> Randy, are you, like,
the leader of the tribe now? >> No.
We're just sitting here talking, dude.
>> I'm not... >> If you want to start, we'll
start it. >> It just seems like lately,
like the last couple of days, you kind of been trying to step
up into the leadership role. I don't know if that's what you
want to do, but you sure are jumpy about it.
>> No, we decided this tribe doesn't need a leader.
So what's your point? Are you asking me if I want
to be leader? Okay, the answer's no.
And, you know, I don't want to talk about it anymore.
Drop it. >> I don't have to drop nothing,
man. I can ask you something if I
want. >> And I can just ignore you
then. >> You can do that if you want.
>> I don't think we've pulled together as a team.
We'd have a much better chance if we were more unified and
thinking of this as a team, rather than, you know, fighting
amongst each other. >> Oh, my God!
>> Ooh! >> Whoo!
>> A fish. It's amazing.
>> Yay! >> Our hero.
>> My alliance right now is with Marcus, Corinne, and
Jacquie. Beyond that, I think Paloma and
Kelly are really tight. And Sugar is attached to Ace.
And I definitely think Bob is woo-able, and can be used as a
swing vote. So there is always the concern
that the other five might bond together, but I think the other
five are so all over the place, that we'll be able to keep the
four together. >> It's his way or no way.
>> Like, right now, they're just, like, he's like the king,
and everybody's, like, bowing down to him.
I just want to gag every time he opens his mouth.
>> I know. >> Yeah, I know.
>> I know. >> For some reason, me and Ace
decided we had some kind of connection.
I trust Ace. And I believe that he's going
to take care of me as much as he can.
>> You guys! >> Tree mail!
>> Okay, ready? "This head-to-head battle
requires a well-balanced team. To win some camp comfort,
you'll kick and you'll scream." Totally bedding.
>> Bedding! >> Bedding!
>> We've got water. >> Right.
>> I mean, obviously, I'm not going to say let's throw
the challenge, but I'm  saying I'd rather we put out
people that are stronger today, so we have those people that
are stronger for the immunity challenge.
>> Yeah, exactly. >> Because I can live without
bedding, but I'd rather not go to Tribal.
>> Everybody seems to adore Ace at this point because right now
everybody's just bowing down to him.
They think he's the king, but I can see through it, so I'm not
blinded by it. But you know, just from talking
to Kelly, I know she has the same frustration.
We both are over him. >> PROBST: Come on in, guys.
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa Kota getting your first look
at the new Fang Tribe. Gillian voted out at the last
Tribal Council. You guys ready to get to
today's reward challenge? >> Yes.
>> Absolutely. >> PROBST: For today's
challenge, one member of each tribe will be stationed at a

other tribe will race out and attempt to remove you from that

First tribe to get the member of the other tribe across the

positions each round. First tribe to score two points
wins reward. Want to know what you're
playing for? >> Yeah.
>> Yes. >> Yeah.
>> PROBST: Comfort. >> Yeah!
(applause) >> PROBST: Blankets, hammock,
pillows, mat. In addition, the winning tribe

Worth playing for? >> Yeah.
>> You know it. >> PROBST: Because this

>> Kenny. >> Kenny.
>> PROBST: Ken's going to be the man sitting out for Fang.

>> PROBST: Corinne, Jacquie, Kelly.
Everybody else, head up to the start.

Wow, you're that relaxed. The attackers for Kota are

For reward. Survivors ready?
Go! It's going to be good and
physical. Dan, hanging on tight.

>> Come on, y'all! Let's go!
>> PROBST: Marcus and Charlie got Dan off the post.

>> PROBST: Ace not budging against GC and Matty.
Marcus and Charlie inching him closer, little by little.
(cheering) GC, you got to dig deeper

>> Come on, Charlie! >> PROBST: Kota very close.
GC has given up. Kota scores the first point!
Kota leads 1-zip. >> PROBST: Kota leads 1-zip.
Next round, Susie will be on the post for Fang.
Paloma will be on the post for Kota.
The attackers for Kota: Bob and Sugar.
The attackers for Fang: Randy and Crystal.
If Kota scores this point, Kota wins reward.
Survivors ready? Go!
This match looks a little more uneven with Crystal and Randy

>> PROBST: Randy and Crystal have Paloma off the post very

hill. >> There you go.
You're done. >> PROBST: Fang scores!

Get some! Come on and get some!
I'm trying to sleep good tonight.
>> PROBST: All right, we are tied 1-1.
We're back to the original match-up: Ace and Dan on the

this time. Marcus and Bob attacking for
Kota. And Crystal and Matty are the
attackers for Fang. This is a final round.
Playing for reward. Kota would like to make sure

Survivors ready? Go!

>> PROBST: You need to dig deep like you've never dug before.
Dan holding on tight against Marcus and Bob.
Ace not budging against Matty and Crystal.

>> PROBST: Matty has the top half of Ace off of the post.

>> PROBST: Crystal and Matty have Ace off the post, and they

Fang wins reward! (cheering)

>> Good job! >> One, two, three-- Fang!
>> PROBST: Fang, congratulations.
Crystal, you look very emotional.

Who are you going to send from Kota to go to Exile Island?

I knew that they were going to pick me 'cause they think

Head back to camp. All right, Fang, nice job.

>> Nice. Everybody, nice.
>> Good job, man. That challenge felt so good.
It felt good for the other tribe to feel the pain that we

>> The reason I held on so long 'cause I got my energy from

I was losing it and you heard me yelling.

>> I mean, we had-- we moved our forces back in perfect

>> But we did take out our strongest girls, you know?
I mean, it was a great, great decision.
>> That was such a brilliant strategy.

>> Yeah. >> No.

Sort of crossed and dotted the "T"s on her contract of death.

Getting in that cage and having comfort, it would have been

"Across the lake you see so well, there lies a sandy crater.

Looks like I got to go through a jungle.
No problem. (gasps): Oh, my God!
Oh, my God! Oh, my God!
Oh! (screams)
This is not my normal thing, obviously.
I'm not a camper. I don't like to be dirty.

My father passed away seven months ago.
I'm trying to, trying to keep it together because when I stay

I'm sure I'll be a stronger person by the end of it all.
Playing this game will help me at this time in my life.
Oh, thank God! (laughs)
Holy... Oh, my God.
Did I find... the thing? Or is this a joke?
"Now turn around, go back towards the lake.

What? That looks like it could be one

start with this one. Oh... cool.

(gasps): Oh, my God! I found it!
Okay, good. Thank God.

That's it. And it doesn't really matter

For today's challenge, one at a time, you will launch yourself

Kota, you have two extra members.
